Detailed Description

This is the base class for a page to show a hierarchy of preferences to the user.

This class only allowed the display of a single set of preference; This functionality should now be found in the new PreferenceFragment class.

This page shows one or more headers of preferences, each of which is associated with a PreferenceFragment to display the preferences of that header. The actual layout and display of these associations can however vary; currently there are two major approaches it may take:

  • On a small screen it may display only the headers as a single list when first launched. Selecting one of the header items will re-launch the page with it only showing the PreferenceFragment of that header.
  • On a large screen in may display both the headers and current PreferenceFragment together as panes. Selecting a header item switches to showing the correct PreferenceFragment for that item.

Subclasses of PreferencePage should implement onBuildHeaders to populate the header list with the desired items. Doing this implicitly switches the class into its new "headers + fragments" mode rather than the old style of just showing a single preferences list.

Sample Code

The following sample code shows a simple preference page that has two different sets of preferences. The implementation, consisting of the page itself as well as its two preference fragments is:

{ sdk/example/ui/PreferenceDemo/src/PreferenceDemo.cpp}

See PreferenceFragment for information on implementing the fragments themselves.

Member Function Documentation

gaia::ui::PreferencePage::DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN ( PreferencePage  ) [private]
static const base::String gaia::ui::PreferencePage::EXTRA_NO_HEADERS ( ) [static]

When starting this activity, the invoking Intent can contain this extra bool that the header list should not be displayed.

This is most often used in conjunction with EXTRA_SHOW_FRAGMENT to launch the activity to display a specific fragment that the user has navigated to.

static const base::String gaia::ui::PreferencePage::EXTRA_SHOW_FRAGMENT ( ) [static]

When starting this activity, the invoking Intent can contain this extra string to specify which fragment should be initially displayed.

static const base::String gaia::ui::PreferencePage::EXTRA_SHOW_FRAGMENT_ARGUMENTS ( ) [static]

When starting this activity and using EXTRA_SHOW_FRAGMENT, this extra can also be specified to supply a Bundle of arguments to pass to that fragment when it is instantiated during the initial creation of PreferenceActivity.

bool gaia::ui::PreferencePage::hasHeaders ( )

Returns true if this activity is currently showing the header list.

void gaia::ui::PreferencePage::invalidateHeaders ( )

Call when you need to change the headers being displayed.

virtual void gaia::ui::PreferencePage::onBuildHeaders ( PreferenceHeaderList *  target) [virtual]

Called when the page needs its list of headers build.

By implementing this and adding at least one item to the list, you will cause the page to run in its modern fragment mode. Note that this function may not always be called; for example, if the page has been asked to display a particular fragment without the header list, there is no need to build the headers.

Parameters:
targetThe list in which to place the headers.
void gaia::ui::PreferencePage::setListFooter ( core::Widget *  widget)

Set a footer that should be shown at the bottom of the header list.

void gaia::ui::PreferencePage::startPreferenceFragment ( core::Fragment *  fragment,
bool  push 
)

Start a new fragment.

Parameters:
fragmentThe fragment to start
pushIf true, the current fragment will be pushed onto the back stack. If false, the current fragment will be replaced.
void gaia::ui::PreferencePage::startPreferencePanel ( const base::String &  fragmentClass,
const core::Persistence &  args 
)

Start a new fragment containing a preference panel.

If the prefences are being displayed in multi-pane mode, the given fragment class will be instantiated and placed in the appropriate pane. If running in single-pane mode, a new activity will be launched in which to show the fragment.

Parameters:
fragmentClassFull name of the class implementing the fragment.
argsAny desired arguments to supply to the fragment.
